title.narrative: Denmark's general contribution to UNHCR 2021

description.narrative: The objective of the Danish core contribution to UNHCR is directly linked to the implementation of the priorities of Danish humanitarian and development cooperation by protecting conflict affected populations and helping to address complex challenges related to forced displacement as well as to finding durable solutions for refugees and IDP’s.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the United Nation's Office in Geneva

mailing-address.narrative: Mission permanente du Danemark auprés de l'Office des Nations Unies à Genéve, 56 rue de Moillebeau, Case Postale 435

description.narrative: FL §06.39.01.10 The Office of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1.3. % of stateless persons for whom nationality granted or confirmed.
Achievement of the target results under output 1.3.

target.value: - Seek improvements in citizenship laws in 40 countries, so as to be consistent with international standards on the prevention of statelessness. - Seek to increase the percentage of stateless people who acquire or confirm nationality in 14 situations.

title.narrative: 3.1. Extent known SGBV survivors receive appropriate support.
Achievement of the target results under output 3.1.

target.value: Provide and seek improved provision of support to known SGBV survivors in 95 refugee operations, 10 situations where UNHCR is operationally involved with IDPs, and 3 returnee situations.

title.narrative: 3.2. Extent community is active in SGBV prevention and survivor-centred protection.
Achievement of the target results under output 3.2.

target.value: Seek improved community involvement in SGBV prevention and protection of survivors in 58 refugee situations, 8 situations where UNHCR is operationally involved with IDPs, and 4 returnee situations.

title.narrative: 7.1. % of primary school-aged children enrolled in primary education.
Achievement of the target results under output 7.1.

target.value: Seek improved enrolment rate of primary school-aged children in 95 refugee situations.

title.narrative: 6.1. % of active female participants in leadership/management structures.
Achievement of the target results under output 6.1.

target.value: Seek improved participation of women in leadership/management structures in 54 refugee situations and 4 situations where UNHCR is operationally involved with IDPs.

title.narrative: 6.2. Extent local communities support continued presence of people of concern.
Achievement of the target results under output 6.2.

target.value: Seek improvements in relations between people of concern and local communities in 65 refugee situations.

title.narrative: 1.2. Extent law and policy consistent with international standards relating to internal displacement and on prevention of statelessness.
Achievement of the target results under output 1.2.

target.value: Seek improvements to national law and policy in 17 countries, so as to be consistent with international standards concerning IDPs.

title.narrative: 1.1. Extent law consistent with international standards relating to refugees.
Achievement of the target results under output 1.1.

target.value: Seek improvements to national law and policy in 80 countries so as to be consistent with international standards concerning refugees and asylum-seekers.

title.narrative: 3.4. Extent children of concern have non-discriminatory access to national child protection and social services.
Achievement of the target results under output 3.4.

target.value: Seek increase in the non-discriminatory access to national child protection and social services in 37 refugee situations, 4 situations where UNHCR is operationally involved with IDPs, and 3 returnee situations.

title.narrative: 2.1. % of children under 12 months old who have been issued with a birth certificate by the authorities.
Achievement of the target results under output 2.1.

target.value: Seek to increase the systematic issuance of birth certificates to newborn children in 53 situations.

title.narrative: 4.1. Prevalence of global acute malnutrition (GAM) (6-59 months).
Achievement of the target results under output 4.1.

target.value: Seek to maintain UNHCR standards or reduce level of GAM in 36 situations where refugees live in camps or settlements.

title.narrative: 4.2. Under-5 mortality rate.
Achievement of the target results under output 4.2.

target.value: Seek to maintain UNHCR standards or reduce mortality levels of children under 5 years old in 44 situations where refugees live in camps or settlements.

title.narrative: 2.2. % of people of concern registered on an individual basis.
Achievement of the target results under output 2.2.

target.value: Seek to maintain or increase levels of individual registration in 96 refugee situations.

title.narrative: 5.2. Average number of litres of potable water available per person per day.
Achievement of the target results under output 5.2.

target.value: Seek to maintain or increase the level of water supply in 46 refugee situations.

title.narrative: 5.1. % of households living in adequate dwellings.
Achievement of the target results under output 5.1.

target.value: Seek to maintain or increase the percentage of households living in adequate dwellings in 48 refugee situations, 15 situations where UNHCR is operationally involved with IDPs, and 7 returnee situations.

title.narrative: 6.3. % of people of concern (18-59 years) with own business/self-employed for more than 12 months.
Achievement of the target results under output 6.3.

target.value: Seek to maintain or increase the percentage of people of concern who are supported to improve their business/self-employment opportunities in 38 operations.

title.narrative: 8.4. % of people of concern, identified in need of resettlement, submitted for resettlement.
Achievement of the target results under output 8.4.

target.value: Seek to maintain or increase the percentage of people submitted for resettlement, among those identified in need of resettlement, thereby supporting solutions in 74 situations.

title.narrative: 3.3. % of unaccompanied and separated children for whom a best interest process has been initiated or completed.
Achievement of the target results under output 3.3.

target.value: Seek to maintain or increase the proportion of unaccompanied or separated refugee children for whom a best interest process has been completed or initiated in 74 refugee situations.

title.narrative: 8.3. Extent social and economic integration is realized.
Achievement of the target results under output 8.3.

target.value: Support local integration in 42 refugee situations where conditions permit.

title.narrative: 8.1. Extent return has been voluntary, and in safety and dignity.
Achievement of the target results under output 8.1.

target.value: Support refugees to return voluntarily, and in safety and dignity, in 40 situations where conditions permit.

title.narrative: 8.2. Extent returnees have same access to rights as other citizens.
Achievement of the target results under output 8.2.

target.value: Support returnees in 11 situations to reintegrate in a sustainable manner, with the same access to rights as other citizens.
